title: Remind me again why the hell %HP TRUE damage exists
body: An uncounterable damage type should never exist, period.

Fiora and Vayne have % max health true damage in their passive and W, respectively. Garen has % max health true damage against the Villain with autos and E, and % missing health true damage (also against the Villain) with his ult. Executes (Urgot and Pyke ults) start by dealing 100% of the target's current health in true damage. Redemption and Salvation deal % max health true damage in an AoE via their active.

Ah, I forgot about Garen's villain mechanic. 

 Personally I wouldn't include Urgot/Pyke in that grouping even though it's technically correct, since if you get hit by it you're 100% dead 100% of the time. :p There's not really anything to play around other than not being below a certain threshold and not getting hit.

It exists to allow for characters who are excellent anti-tank champions while not needing to give them absurd power vs. squishy targets. The problem with armor penetration or simply high enough damage to break through defenses is that both of these still greatly impact squishy targets. Percentile true damage, however, can be tuned to deal meaningful damage to high-defense targets while leaving squishy targets much safer.

In short, it's a valuable balancing lever that many people vastly overestimate the actual strength of.

You can argue that the mechanic itself is fine but in the current state of the game and the champions it exists on, its far from ok.

And any champ can deal damage to those tanks if they build armor/magic pen. Just how tanks need to build items to tank damage, damage classes should build penetration items to deal damage to them. they shouldn't be able to just deal damage regardless because they have a passive that gives them uncounterable damage.

%hp damage on other champs is still physical/magic damage so armor and magic resist works.

For example, I played a game as cho'gath and stacked magic resist. The enemy morde stacked magic pen and still dealt tons of damage to me but as a result he didnt have as much damage because he built magic pen and that made him weaker against the other members of my team. You shouldnt be able to just stack damage and ignore tank stats and shred the entire team, you should either itemize to shred tanks with penetration items or damage to burst squishies, not both.

Because it is slow to stack and can actually be counted by attack speed slow items.

Also mix damage like kog or Kai'Sa is MUCH MUCH harder to counter since the champions with do it consistently.

Like Kai'Sa can kill a tank much faster then a vayne since she has more mixed damage where vayne is mostly physical. Do I have to remind you EVERY meta kog is good in he just instantly kills tanks.

You're talking about just Vayne. Fiora and Garen are also champions with the same mechanic and they dont need to stack it and attack speed items don't counter them.

Kai'sa does %hp damage as well as mixed damage so yeah it makes sense she kills tanks but she can be built against since its not true damage, its magic damage based on missing hp. I literally main her on my other acc and I don't kill tanks nearly as fast as I do on Vayne.

Kog'maw literally has a kit built to counter tanks with armor and magic resist shred on Q, %hp damage on W, and blade of the ruined king+rageblade as his core.

%HP true damage is generally very slow at killing compared to actual straight damage. It does well against tanks, not so well against squishies. 

The counter is to just kill the target using it, as you can build more offensive to deal with it (or in vaynes case, can even reduce her attack speed)
